It can become predictable and the challenge lessened

It is usually an increasing descent into madness

The investigator may feel compelled to hide the book away in case it gets 'hurt'.

Other investigators view the Mythos tome in question as a smelly, evil-looking book.

The deluded investigator cannot read another book without the tome's text burning through the print.

To get back to its rightful owner

Gaining some points in the Cthulhu Mythos skill and a couple of spells

The loss of sanity caused by reading the tome

Seeing the book everywhere, even though it was apparently destroyed

a new “corrupted” entry in their background (under Treasured Possessions): “Will not part with the Book of Iod, takes it wherever he goes.”

delusions

the shelves of the common public
